amendment.description: Amendment sought to require the Secretary of Defense and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs to report to Congress regarding whether nuclear weapons reductions pursuant to the new START Treaty are in the national security interests of the United States.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 31 printed in House Report 112-485 to require the Secretary of Defense and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs to report to Congress regarding whether nuclear weapons reductions pursuant to the new START Treaty are in the national security interests of the United States.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Johnson (GA) amendment (A023) Failed by recorded vote: 175 - 245 (Roll no. 279).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Johnson (GA) amendment (A023) Failed by recorded vote: 175 - 245 (Roll no. 279).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A023) offered by Mr. Johnson (GA).
